content:
PeerNearMe Class

Definition

Represents a peer located by the "People Near Me" infrastructure.

In this Article

public class PeerNearMe : System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer, IEquatable<System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
Inheritance
Object
System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer
PeerNearMe

Inherited Members

Dispose()
Equals(Peer)
GetObjects()
GetObjects(Guid)
GetPresenceInfo(PeerEndPoint)
InviteAsyncCancel(Object)
InviteCompleted
IsOnline
OnInviteCompleted(InviteCompletedEventArgs)
PeerEndPoints
SynchronizingObject
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

An instance of this class cannot be created directly. Instead, a reference to the peers "near" the calling peer is obtained by using the static GetPeersNearMe method to return a collection of nearby peers.

A peer represented by a PeerNearMe object is not necessarily in the calling peer's address book.

Constructors

PeerNearMe()

Initializes a new default instance of the PeerNearMe class.

public PeerNearMe ();

PeerNearMe(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

Initializes a new PeerNearMe instance with the associated parameters required for serialization.

protected PeerNearMe (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo serializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext streamingContext);
serializationInfo
SerializationInfo

The SerializationInfo associated with the PeerNearMe.

streamingContext
StreamingContext

The serialization destination associated with the PeerNearMe.

Properties

Nickname

Gets or sets a String representing the Nickname of the PeerNearMe object.

public string Nickname { get; }
Value
String

String that represents the Nickname of the PeerNearMe object.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerNearMe object has been disposed.

Remarks

If a contact is generated from a PeerNearMe object, the associated contact Nickname is populated with this property value.

Methods

AddToContactManager()

Generates a PeerContact from the PeerNearMe object and associates it with the ContactManager.

public System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact AddToContactManager ();
Returns
PeerContact

PeerContact object associated with the PeerEndPoint.

Exceptions
PeerToPeerException

The Collaboration infrastructure has failed to create and associate a PeerContact with the ContactManager.

AddToContactManager(String,String,MailAddress)

Generates a PeerContact with the associated descriptive parameters from the PeerNearMe object and associates it with the ContactManager.

public System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact AddToContactManager (string displayName, string nickname, System.Net.Mail.MailAddress emailAddress);
displayName
String

The display name assigned to the newly created contact.

nickname
String

The nickname to assign to the newly created contact.

emailAddress
MailAddress

MailAddress object that specifies the email address to assign to the newly created contact.

Returns
PeerContact

PeerContact object associated with a PeerNearMe containing descriptive parameters.

Exceptions
PeerToPeerException

The Collaboration infrastructure has failed to create or update a PeerContact with the ContactManager.

CreateFromPeerEndPoint(PeerEndPoint)

Generates a PeerNearMe object from the provided PeerEndPoint.

public static System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe CreateFromPeerEndPoint (System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint peerEndPoint);
peerEndPoint
PeerEndPoint

PeerEndPoint object that specifies the endpoint associated with the peer.

Returns
PeerNearMe

PeerNearMe object associated with the PeerEndPoint.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The peerEndPoint is null.

PeerToPeerException

The referenced stem.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.EndPoint* specifies null.

Remarks

If the provided PeerEndPoint does not map to a signed-in peer on the same subnet, null is returned.

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the PeerNearMe object and optionally releases the managed resources.

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

Set to true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

Compares the PeerNearMe to the specified PeerNearMe instance.

Returns true if the PeerNearMe instance provided has matching data, else false.

Exceptions

The other argument is null.

Compares the PeerNearMe instance to the specified object.

public override bool Equals (object obj);

The object to test for equality.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the PeerNearMe instance provided has matching data, else false.

Exceptions

objB

Boolean

Returns true if the PeerNearMe instances provided have matching data, else false.

Returns the hash code for the PeerNearMe instance.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

A 32-bit signed integer hash code used to compare instances of this type.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerNearMe object has been disposed.

GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

Populates a SerializationInfo with the data required to serialize the specified PeerNearMe. A derived type must call the base type stem.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData* method.

protected override void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
info
SerializationInfo

The SerializationInfo to populate with data.

context
StreamingContext

The destination for the serialization.

InternalRefreshData(Object)

Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a PeerNearMe instance.

protected void InternalRefreshData (object state);
state
Object

Specifies the application, object, and presence data relevant to a PeerNearMe instance.

Remarks

The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the GetApplications and GetObjects methods as well as the PresenceStatus property. The InternalRefreshData method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified Peer, PeerNearMe, or PeerContact.

This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and the cache has been updated.

The caller is not required to sign in with the SignIn method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.

Invite()

Sends an invitation to join a peer collaboration application to a remote peer.

public override System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse Invite ();
Returns
PeerInvitationResponse

PeerInvitationResponse object containing the relevant PeerInvitationResponseType value specified by the remote peer.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerNearMe object has been disposed.

PeerToPeerException

  • The PeerEndPoint associated with the PeerApplication specified by the PeerEndPointCollection is null or has a value count of '0' associated endpoints.

  • A Guid has not been associated with the current peer-to-peer application.

Invite(PeerApplication,String,Byte[])

Sends an invitation to join a peer collaboration application to a remote peer that includes data that describes or specifies the application invite.

public override System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse Invite (System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication applicationToInvite, string message, byte[] invitationData);
applicationToInvite
PeerApplication

Specifies the relevant Peer Collaboration application represented by a PeerApplication instance.

message
String

A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation. The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.

invitationData
Byte[]

A user defined data blob to associate with the invitation. Size is limited to 16K (16,384 bytes).

Returns
PeerInvitationResponse

PeerInvitationResponse object containing the relevant PeerInvitationResponseType value specified by the remote peer.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerApplication object has been disposed.

ArgumentNullException

The applicationToInvite argument specifies null.

PeerToPeerException

  • The applicationToInvite argument specifies an empty Guid.

  • The PeerEndPoint associated with the PeerApplication specified by the PeerEndPointCollection is null or has a value count of '0' associated endpoints.

InviteAsync(Object)

Receives an invitation response from a peer regarding joining a peer collaboration application.

public override void InviteAsync (object userToken);
userToken
Object

User-defined object passed to the callback of the asynchronous operation for identification. This required parameter must be unique across all asynchronous invitation operations still in-progress.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerApplication object has been disposed.

ArgumentException

The userToken argument specifies null.

PeerToPeerException

This PeerApplication object does not specify a valid Guid.

InviteAsync(PeerApplication,String,Byte[],Object)

Receives an invitation response from a peer regarding an invitation to a peer collaboration application.

public override void InviteAsync (System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication applicationToInvite, string message, byte[] invitationData, object userToken);
applicationToInvite
PeerApplication

Specifies the relevant Peer Collaboration application information represented by a PeerApplication object.

message
String

A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation. The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.

invitationData
Byte[]

A user defined data blob to associate with the invitation. Size is limited to 16K.

userToken
Object

User-defined object passed to the callback of the asynchronous operation for identification. This required parameter must be unique across all asynchronous invitation operations still in-progress.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerApplication object has been disposed.

ArgumentNullException

The applicationToInvite argument specifies null.

ArgumentException

The userToken argument specifies null.

PeerToPeerException

  • The endpoint specified by PeerApplication was not found.

  • The applicationToInvite argument specifies an empty Guid.

OnRefreshDataCompleted(RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs)

Signals the RefreshDataCompleted event.

protected void OnRefreshDataCompleted (System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs e);
e
RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs

Event data contained in a RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs instance.

Remarks

Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the RefreshDataCompleted event occurs.

This method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

RefreshData()

Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a PeerNearMe instance.

public void RefreshData ();
Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerNearMe object has been disposed.

Remarks

The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the GetApplications and GetObjects methods as well as the PresenceStatus property. This method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified Peer, PeerNearMe, or PeerContact.

This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and cache has been updated.

The caller is not required to sign in with the SignIn method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.

RefreshDataAsync(Object)

Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a PeerNearMe instance.

public void RefreshDataAsync (object userToken);
userToken
Object

User-specified state object that is passed to the delegate when this method completes the operation.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerNearMe object has been disposed.

ArgumentNullException

The userToken argument specifies null.

PeerToPeerException

The prior RefreshDataAsync call has not yet completed.

Remarks

The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the GetApplications and GetObjects methods as well as the PresenceStatus property. The InternalRefreshData method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified Peer, PeerNearMe, or PeerContact.

This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and cache has been updated.

The caller is not required to sign in with the SignIn method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.

ToString()

Returns String that represents a PeerNearMe instance.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

String representing the PeerObject.

Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerNearMe object has been disposed.

Events

PeerNearMeChanged

Signaled when a new PeerNearMe instance is found, no longer available, or the associated PeerEndPoint object information has changed.

public static event EventHandler<System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMeChangedEventArgs> PeerNearMeChanged;

RefreshDataCompleted

Signaled when the stem.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData* or stem.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshDataAsync* operation for the PeerNearMe instance is completed.

public event EventHandler<System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs> RefreshDataCompleted;
Exceptions
ObjectDisposedException

The PeerNearMe object has been disposed.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ISerializable.GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

Populates the current PeerNearMe instance with the data obtained from the serialized source.

void ISerializable.GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
info
SerializationInfo

The SerializationInfo to populate with data.

context
StreamingContext

The destination for the serialization.
